About

My name is Dale, and I study Computer Science at Princeton University (class of 2015). I’m interested in all sorts of stuff, from tinkering around with hardware to building brain-computer interfaces to figuring out how to use machine learning techniques to better analyze the data I get from the noisy sensors on hardware devices. I’m also interested in exploring how I can use DIY fabrication/protoyping techniques to make my own, personal life more fun and future-y. I’m from the east coast and I love coffee.
